title: Ford v Ferrari
des: American car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles battle corporate interference, the laws of physics and their own personal demons to build a revolutionary race car for Ford and challenge Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.

title: The Irishman
des: A mob hitman recalls his possible involvement with the slaying of Jimmy Hoffa.

title: The King
des: Hal, wayward prince and heir to the English throne, is crowned King Henry V after his tyrannical father dies. Now the young king must navigate palace politics, the war his father left behind, and the emotional strings of his past life.

title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood
des: Based on the true story of a real-life friendship between Fred Rogers and journalist Tom Junod.

title: Seberg
des: Inspired by real events in the life of French New Wave icon Jean Seberg, who in the late 1960s was targeted by Hoover's FBI, because of her political and romantic involvement with civil rights activist Hakim Jamal.

title: Harriet
des: The extraordinary tale of Harriet Tubman's escape from slavery and transformation into one of America's greatest heroes, whose courage, ingenuity, and tenacity freed hundreds of slaves and changed the course of history.

title: Dark Waters
des: A corporate defense attorney takes on an environmental lawsuit against a chemical company that exposes a lengthy history of pollution.

title: Dolemite Is My Name
des: Eddie Murphy portrays real-life legend Rudy Ray Moore, a comedy and rap pioneer who proved naysayers wrong when his hilarious, obscene, kung-fu fighting alter ego, Dolemite, became a 1970s Blaxploitation phenomenon.

title: Goodfellas
des: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.

title: Official Secrets
des: The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq.

title: Rocketman
des: A musical fantasy about the fantastical human story of Elton John's breakthrough years.

title: Bombshell
des: A group of women decide to take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network.

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
des: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

title: Bohemian Rhapsody
des: The story of the legendary British rock band Queen and lead singer Freddie Mercury, leading up to their famous performance at Live Aid (1985).

title: Narcos
des: A chronicled look at the criminal exploits of Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar, as well as the many other drug kingpins who plagued the country through the years.

title: The Favourite
des: In early 18th century England, a frail Queen Anne occupies the throne and her close friend, Lady Sarah, governs the country in her stead. When a new servant, Abigail, arrives, her charm endears her to Sarah.

title: Spartacus
des: The life of Spartacus, the gladiator who lead a rebellion against the Romans. From his time as an ally of the Romans, to his betrayal and becoming a gladiator, to the rebellion he leads and its ultimate outcome.

title: Dickinson
des: An inside look at the world of writer Emily Dickinson.

title: Green Book
des: A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver of an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South.

title: The Greatest Showman
des: Celebrates the birth of show business and tells of a visionary who rose from nothing to create a spectacle that became a worldwide sensation.

title: The Sound of Music
des: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.

title: Schindler's List
des: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

title: Vice
des: The story of Dick Cheney, an unassuming bureaucratic Washington insider, who quietly wielded immense power as Vice President to George W. Bush, reshaping the country and the globe in ways that we still feel today.

title: Remember the Titans
des: The true story of a newly appointed African-American coach and his high school team on their first season as a racially integrated unit.

title: When They See Us
des: Five teens from Harlem become trapped in a nightmare when they're falsely accused of a brutal attack in Central Park. Based on the true story.

title: Dog Day Afternoon
des: A man robs a bank to pay for his lover's operation, which turns into a hostage situation and a media circus.

title: Braveheart
des: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.

title: Hacksaw Ridge
des: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, who served during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people, and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

title: American Crime Story
des: An anthology series centered around America's most notorious crimes and criminals.

title: A Hidden Life
des: The Austrian Blessed Franz Jägerstätter, a conscientious objector, refuses to fight for the Nazis in World War II.

title: Catherine the Great
des: Story of the greatest tsarina, Catherine the Great and the Hermitage.

title: The Revenant
des: A frontiersman on a fur trading expedition in the 1820s fights for survival after being mauled by a bear and left for dead by members of his own hunting team.

title: BlacKkKlansman
des: Ron Stallworth, an African American police officer from Colorado Springs, CO, successfully manages to infiltrate the local Ku Klux Klan branch with the help of a Jewish surrogate who eventually becomes its leader. Based on actual events.

title: Fighting with My Family
des: A former wrestler and his family make a living performing at small venues around the country while his kids dream of joining World Wrestling Entertainment.

title: Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil and Vile
des: A chronicle of the crimes of Ted Bundy from the perspective of Liz, his longtime girlfriend, who refused to believe the truth about him for years.

title: The Big Short
des: In 2006-2007 a group of investors bet against the US mortgage market. In their research they discover how flawed and corrupt the market is.

title: Catch Me If You Can
des: A seasoned FBI agent pursues Frank Abagnale Jr. who, before his 19th birthday, successfully forged millions of dollars' worth of checks while posing as a Pan Am pilot, a doctor, and a legal prosecutor.

title: Rush
des: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.

title: The Current War
des: The dramatic story of the cutthroat race between electricity titans Thomas Edison and George Westinghouse to determine whose electrical system would power the modern world.

title: Judy
des: Legendary performer Judy Garland arrives in London in the winter of 1968 to perform a series of sold-out concerts.

title: Molly's Game
des: The true story of Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game and became an FBI target.

title: The Aeronauts
des: Pilot Amelia Wren (Felicity Jones) and scientist James Glaisher (Eddie Redmayne) find themselves in an epic fight for survival while attempting to make discoveries in a gas balloon.

title: Mary Queen of Scots
des: Mary Stuart's attempt to overthrow her cousin Elizabeth I, Queen of England, finds her condemned to years of imprisonment before facing execution.

title: First Man
des: A look at the life of the astronaut, Neil Armstrong, and the legendary space mission that led him to become the first man to walk on the Moon on July 20, 1969.

title: The Blind Side
des: The story of Michael Oher, a homeless and traumatized boy who became an All-American football player and first-round NFL draft pick with the help of a caring woman and her family.

title: Into the Wild
des: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

title: Victoria
des: The early life of Queen Victoria, from her ascension to the throne at the tender age of 18 to her courtship and marriage to Prince Albert.

title: Blow
des: The story of how George Jung, along with the Medellín Cartel headed by Pablo Escobar, established the American cocaine market in the 1970s in the United States.

title: The Social Network
des: As Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, he is sued by the twins who claimed he stole their idea, and by the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.

title: Walk the Line
des: A chronicle of country music legend Johnny Cash's life, from his early days on an Arkansas cotton farm to his rise to fame with Sun Records in Memphis, where he recorded alongside Elvis Presley, Jerry Lee Lewis, and Carl Perkins.

title: Darkest Hour
des: In May 1940, the fate of Western Europe hangs on British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, who must decide whether to negotiate with Adolf Hitler, or fight on knowing that it could mean a humiliating defeat for Britain and its empire.

title: Outlaw King
des: A true David vs. Goliath story of how the 14th century Scottish 'Outlaw King' Robert the Bruce used cunning and bravery to defeat the much larger and better equipped occupying English army.

title: The Dirt
des: Based on the bestselling autobiography from Mötley Crüe, the film is an unflinching tale of success and excess as four misfits rise from the streets of Hollywood to the heights of international fame.

title: Skin
des: A destitute young man, raised by racist skinheads and notorious among white supremacists, turns his back on hatred and violence to transform his life, with the help of a black activist and the woman he loves.

title: The King's Speech
des: The story of King George VI, his impromptu ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.

title: The Kid
des: The story of a young boy who witnesses Billy the Kid's encounter with Sheriff Pat Garrett.

title: Raging Bull
des: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, whose violence and temper that led him to the top in the ring destroyed his life outside of it.

title: Medici
des: A political family drama set in Florence in the early fifteenth century. Cosimo de Medici finds himself at the helm of his banking dynasty when his father, Giovanni, dies suddenly.

title: I, Tonya
des: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U.S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the activity is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.

title: The Pianist
des: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

title: The Act
des: Dee Dee Blanchard is overprotective of her daughter, Gypsy, who is trying to escape the toxic relationship she has with her mother. Gypsy's quest for independence opens up a Pandora's box of secrets, which ultimately leads to murder. The stranger-than-fiction true-crime series is based on a 2016 BuzzFeed article that detailed the shocking 2015 crime.

title: Beautiful Boy
des: Based on the best-selling pair of memoirs from father and son David and Nic Sheff, Beautiful Boy chronicles the heartbreaking and inspiring experience of survival, relapse, and recovery in a family coping with addiction over many years.

title: The Highwaymen
des: The untold true story of the legendary detectives who brought down Bonnie and Clyde.

title: A Beautiful Mind
des: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

title: The Imitation Game
des: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians.

title: 12 Years a Slave
des: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

title: The Disaster Artist
des: When Greg Sestero, an aspiring film actor, meets the weird and mysterious Tommy Wiseau in an acting class, they form a unique friendship and travel to Hollywood to make their dreams come true.

title: Wu-Tang: An American Saga
des: The show tracks the Wu Tang Clan's formation, a vision of Bobby Diggs, who strives to unite a dozen young, black men that are torn between music and crime but eventually rise to become the unlikeliest of American success stories.

title: Spotlight
des: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

title: Legend
des: Identical twin gangsters Ronald and Reginald Kray terrorize London during the 1960s.

title: American Sniper
des: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's (Bradley Cooper's) pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home to his wife and kids after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.

title: Saving Mr. Banks
des: Author P.L. Travers reflects on her childhood after reluctantly meeting with Walt Disney, who seeks to adapt her Mary Poppins books for the big screen.

title: Tolkien
des: The formative years of the orphaned author J.R.R. Tolkien as he finds friendship, love and artistic inspiration among a group of fellow outcasts at school.

title: The Intouchables
des: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

title: Girl, Interrupted
des: Based on writer Susanna Kaysen's account of her 18-month stay at a mental hospital in the late 1960s.

title: American Made
des: The story of Barry Seal, an American pilot who became a drug-runner for the CIA in the 1980s in a clandestine operation that would be exposed as the Iran-Contra Affair.

title: The Professor and the Madman
des: Professor James Murray begins work compiling words for the first edition of the Oxford English Dictionary in the mid 19th century, and receives over 10,000 entries from a patient at Broadmoor Criminal Lunatic Asylum, Dr. William Minor.

title: Tombstone
des: A successful lawman's plans to retire anonymously in Tombstone, Arizona, are disrupted by the kind of outlaws he was famous for eliminating.

title: The Danish Girl
des: A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.

title: The Aviator
des: A biopic depicting the early years of legendary Director and aviator Howard Hughes' career from the late 1920s to the mid 1940s.

title: Moneyball
des: Oakland A's general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to assemble a baseball team on a lean budget by employing computer-generated analysis to acquire new players.

title: The Fighter
des: Based on the story of Micky Ward, a fledgling boxer who tries to escape the shadow of his more famous but troubled older boxing brother and get his own shot at greatness.

title: The Loudest Voice
des: Seven-part limited series about Roger Ailes, the founder of Fox News. It focuses on the past decade which Ailes arguably became the Republican Party's de facto leader, and the sexual harassment accusations that brought his career to an end.

title: Argo
des: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1979.

title: Dallas Buyers Club
des: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.

title: The Pursuit of Happyness
des: A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional career.

title: The Post
des: A cover-up that spanned four U.S. Presidents pushed the country's first female newspaper publisher and a hard-driving editor to join an unprecedented battle between the press and the government.

title: Hidden Figures
des: The story of a team of female African-American mathematicians who served a vital role in NASA during the early years of the U.S. space program.

title: Lone Survivor
des: Marcus Luttrell and his team set out on a mission to capture or kill notorious Taliban leader Ahmad Shah, in late June 2005. Marcus and his team are left to fight for their lives in one of the most valiant efforts of modern warfare.

title: Lion
des: A five-year-old Indian boy gets lost on the streets of Calcutta, thousands of kilometers from home. He survives many challenges before being adopted by a couple in Australia. 25 years later, he sets out to find his lost family.

title: Amadeus
des: The life, success and troubles of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, as told by Antonio Salieri, the contemporaneous composer who was insanely jealous of Mozart's talent and claimed to have murdered him.

title: Can You Ever Forgive Me?
des: When Lee Israel falls out of step with current tastes, she turns her art form to deception.

title: Lincoln
des: As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.

title: Brian Banks
des: A football player's dreams to play in the NFL are halted when he is wrongly convicted and sent to prison. Years later, he fights to clear his name within an unjust system.

title: Bonnie and Clyde
des: Bored waitress Bonnie Parker falls in love with an ex-con named Clyde Barrow and together they start a violent crime spree through the country, stealing cars and robbing banks.

title: Snowden
des: The NSA's illegal surveillance techniques are leaked to the public by one of the agency's employees, Edward Snowden, in the form of thousands of classified documents distributed to the press.

title: Double Teamed
des: Two sisters become world-famous basketball players.

title: Boy Erased
des: The son of a Baptist preacher is forced to participate in a church-supported gay conversion program after being forcibly outed to his parents.

title: The Durrells in Corfu
des: Based on the real-life events of the Durrell family as they resettle from England to Greece.

title: Welcome to Marwen
des: A victim of a brutal attack finds a unique and beautiful therapeutic outlet to help him through his recovery process.

title: Diego Maradona
des: Constructed from over 500 hours of never-before-seen footage, this documentary centers on the career of celebrated football player Diego Armando Maradona, who played for S.S.C. Napoli in the 1980s.

title: True History of the Kelly Gang
des: Based on Peter Carey's novel. The story of Australian bush-ranger Ned Kelly and his gang as they flee from authorities during the 1870s.

title: Versailles
des: In 1667, 28-year-old all-powerful king of France, Louis XIV, decides to build the greatest palace in the world - Versailles. But drained budget, affairs and political intrigues complicate things.

title: The Theory of Everything
des: A look at the relationship between the famous physicist Stephen Hawking and his wife.

title: Miracle
des: The true story of Herb Brooks, the player-turned-coach who led the 1980 U.S. Olympic hockey team to victory over the seemingly invincible Russian squad.

title: Won't You Be My Neighbor?
des: An exploration of the life, lessons, and legacy of iconic children's television host, Fred Rogers.

title: American Gangster
des: An outcast New York City cop is charged with bringing down Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas, whose real life inspired this partly biographical film.

title: Right on Track
des: Fact-based drama chronicling the story of two determined sisters who battled the prejudice of a male-dominated sport to become world-class drag racers.

title: Papillon
des: Wrongfully convicted for murder, Henri Charriere forms an unlikely relationship with fellow inmate and quirky convicted counterfeiter Louis Dega, in an attempt to escape from the notorious penal colony on Devil's Island.

title: Colette
des: Colette is pushed by her husband to write novels under his name. Upon their success, she fights to make her talents known, challenging gender norms.

title: Erin Brockovich
des: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.

title: War Dogs
des: Loosely based on the true story of two young men, David Packouz and Efraim Diveroli, who won a three hundred million dollar contract from the Pentagon to arm America's allies in Afghanistan.

title: Rise of the Footsoldier: Marbella
des: Fresh out of prison, Pat Tate steps right back into his Essex nightclub business. Since he can't stop brooding about the man who had him put away, it's not long before he's off to Marbella to find Frank Harris and seek his revenge.

title: A Confession
des: Detective Superintendent Steve Fulcher intends on catching a killer of a missing woman, even if that may cost him his career and reputation.

title: Only the Brave
des: Based on the true story of the Granite Mountain Hotshots, a group of elite firefighters who risk everything to protect a town from a historic wildfire.

title: Monster
des: Based on the life of Aileen Wuornos, a Daytona Beach prostitute who became a serial killer.

title: In the Heart of the Sea
des: A recounting of a New England whaling ship's sinking by a giant whale in 1820, an experience that later inspired the great novel Moby-Dick.

title: The Old Man & the Gun
des: Based on the true story of Forrest Tucker and his audacious escape from San Quentin at the age of 70 to an unprecedented string of heists that confounded authorities and enchanted the public.

title: Lawrence of Arabia
des: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

title: Unbroken
des: After a near-fatal plane crash in WWII, Olympian Louis Zamperini spends a harrowing 47 days in a raft with two fellow crewmen before he's caught by the Japanese navy and sent to a prisoner-of-war camp.

title: All the Money in the World
des: The story of the kidnapping of 16-year-old John Paul Getty III and the desperate attempt by his devoted mother to convince his billionaire grandfather Jean Paul Getty to pay the ransom.

title: The Lost City of Z
des: A true-life drama, centering on British explorer Major Percival Fawcett, who disappeared whilst searching for a mysterious city in the Amazon in the 1920s.

title: Genius
des: The life stories of history's greatest minds. From their days as young adults to their final years we see their discoveries, loves, relationships, causes, flaws and genius.

title: On the Basis of Sex
des: The true story of Ruth Bader Ginsburg, her struggles for equal rights, and the early cases of a historic career that lead to her nomination and confirmation as U.S. Supreme Court Associate Justice.

title: Roots
des: A dramatization of author Alex Haley's family line from ancestor Kunta Kinte's enslavement to his descendants' liberation.

title: Bigger
des: The inspirational tale of the grandfathers of fitness as we now know it, Joe and Ben Weider. Facing anti-Semitism and extreme poverty, the brothers beat all odds to build an empire and inspire future generations.

title: Operation Finale
des: A team of secret agents set out to track down the Nazi officer who masterminded the Holocaust.

title: Captain Phillips
des: The true story of Captain Richard Phillips and the 2009 hijacking by Somali pirates of the U.S.-flagged MV Maersk Alabama, the first American cargo ship to be hijacked in two hundred years.

title: At Eternity's Gate
des: A look at the life of painter Vincent van Gogh during the time he lived in Arles and Auvers-sur-Oise, France.

title: Sully
des: The story of Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks), an American pilot who became a hero after landing his damaged plane on the Hudson River in order to save the flight's passengers and crew.

title: Black Mass
des: The true story of Whitey Bulger, the brother of a state senator and the most infamous violent criminal in the history of South Boston, who became an FBI informant to take down a Mafia family invading his turf.

title: The Traitor
des: The real life of Tommaso Buscetta the so called "boss of the two worlds", first mafia informant in Sicily 1980's.

title: Alexander
des: Alexander, the King of Macedonia and one of the greatest army leaders in the history of warfare, conquers much of the known world.

title: Serpico
des: An honest New York cop named Frank Serpico blows the whistle on rampant corruption in the force only to have his comrades turn against him.

title: The Glass Castle
des: A young girl comes of age in a dysfunctional family of nonconformist nomads with a mother who's an eccentric artist and an alcoholic father who would stir the children's imagination with hope as a distraction to their poverty.

title: Invincible
des: Based on the story of Vince Papale, a 30-year-old bartender from South Philadelphia who overcame long odds to play for the NFL's Philadelphia Eagles in 1976.

title: The Queen
des: After the death of Princess Diana, Queen Elizabeth II struggles with her reaction to a sequence of events nobody could have predicted.

title: Boys Don't Cry
des: A young man named Brandon Teena navigates love, life, and being transgender in rural Nebraska.

title: Jarhead
des: A psychological study of operations desert shield and desert storm during the gulf war; through the eyes of a U.S marine sniper who struggles to cope with the possibility his girlfriend may be cheating on him back home.

title: Donnie Brasco
des: An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one.

title: Stan & Ollie
des: Laurel and Hardy, the world's most famous comedy duo, attempt to reignite their film careers as they embark on what becomes their swan song - a grueling theatre tour of post-war Britain.

title: Kill the Irishman
des: The true story of Danny Greene, a tough Irish thug working for mobsters in Cleveland during the 1970's.

title: 127 Hours
des: A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.

title: Public Enemies
des: The Feds try to take down notorious American gangsters John Dillinger, Baby Face Nelson and Pretty Boy Floyd during a booming crime wave in the 1930s.

title: Dear Zachary: A Letter to a Son About His Father
des: A filmmaker decides to memorialize a murdered friend when his friend's ex-girlfriend announces she is expecting his son.

title: Breakthrough
des: When her 14-year-old son drowns in a lake, a faithful mother prays for him to come back from the brink of death and be healed.

title: Straight Outta Compton
des: The group NWA emerges from the mean streets of Compton in Los Angeles, California, in the mid-1980s and revolutionizes Hip Hop culture with their music and tales about life in the hood.

title: Marie Antoinette
des: The retelling of France's iconic but ill-fated queen, Marie Antoinette. From her betrothal and marriage to Louis XVI at 15 to her reign as queen at 19 and to the end of her reign as queen, and ultimately the fall of Versailles.

title: The Founder
des: The story of Ray Kroc, a salesman who turned two brothers' innovative fast food eatery, McDonald's, into the biggest restaurant business in the world, with a combination of ambition, persistence, and ruthlessness.

title: Alias Grace
des: In 19th-century Canada, a psychiatrist weighs whether a murderess should be pardoned due to insanity.

title: Everest
des: The story of New Zealand's Robert "Rob" Edwin Hall, who on May 10, 1996, together with Scott Fischer, teamed up on a joint expedition to ascend Mount Everest.

title: Mask
des: A teenager with a massive facial skull deformity and biker gang mother attempt to live as normal a life as possible under the circumstances.

title: Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot
des: On the rocky path to sobriety after a life-changing accident, John Callahan discovers the healing power of art, willing his injured hands into drawing hilarious, often controversial cartoons, which bring him a new lease on life.

title: Wild
des: A chronicle of one woman's one thousand one hundred mile solo hike undertaken as a way to recover from a recent personal tragedy.

title: Invictus
des: Nelson Mandela (Morgan Freeman), in his first term as President of South African, initiates a unique venture to unite the Apartheid-torn land: enlist the national rugby team on a mission to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup.

title: Fonzo
des: The 47-year old Al Capone, after 10 years in prison, starts suffering from dementia, and comes to be haunted by his violent past.

title: Roman Empire
des: Chronicles some of the most famous leaders of the Roman Civilization.

title: Spartacus
des: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

title: Mary Magdalene
des: Twelve men heard and spread the message of Jesus. Only one woman understood it.

title: Mank
des: Follows screenwriter Herman J. Mankiewicz's tumultuous development of Orson Welles' iconic 1941 movie Citizen Kane.

title: Bronson
des: A young man who was sentenced to seven years in prison for robbing a post office ends up spending three decades in solitary confinement. During this time, his own personality is supplanted by his alter-ego, Charles Bronson.

title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
des: In the 1913 US Open, 20-year-old Francis Ouimet played golf against his idol, 1900 US Open champion, Englishman Harry Vardon.

title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
des: Robert Ford, who's idolized Jesse James since childhood, tries hard to join the reforming gang of the Missouri outlaw, but gradually becomes resentful of the bandit leader.

title: Escape at Dannemora
des: An employee at a prison in upstate New York becomes romantically involved with a pair of inmates and helps them escape.

title: The Elephant Man
des: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak. Behind his monstrous façade, there is revealed a person of kindness, intelligence and sophistication.

title: Da Vinci's Demons
des: Follows Leonardo Da Vinci during his early days in Florence, as a young artist, inventor and dreamer, trying to change the future.

title: Fosse/Verdon
des: An inside look at the romantic and creative partnership between influential choreographer/director, Bob Fosse, and Gwen Verdon, one of the greatest Broadway dancers of all time.

title: Coach Carter
des: Controversy surrounds high school basketball coach Ken Carter after he benches his entire team for breaking their academic contract with him.

title: Foxcatcher
des: U.S. Olympic wrestling champions and brothers Mark Schultz and Dave Schultz join "Team Foxcatcher", led by eccentric multi-millionaire John du Pont, as they train for the 1988 Olympic Games in Seoul, South Korea, but John's self-destructive behavior threatens to consume them all.

title: Midnight Express
des: Billy Hayes (Brad Davis), an American college student, is caught smuggling drugs out of Turkey and thrown into prison.

title: Munich
des: Based on the true story of the Black September aftermath, about the five men chosen to eliminate the ones responsible for that fateful day.

title: Driven
des: Intense thriller where politics, big business and narcotics collide.

title: Adrift
des: A true story of survival, as a young couple's chance encounter leads them first to love, and then on the adventure of a lifetime as they face one of the most catastrophic hurricanes in recorded history.

title: Rudy
des: Rudy has always been told that he was too small to play college football. But he is determined to overcome the odds and fulfill his dream of playing for Notre Dame.

title: Steve Jobs
des: Steve Jobs takes us behind the scenes of the digital revolution, to paint a portrait of the man at its epicenter. The story unfolds backstage at three iconic product launches, ending in 1998 with the unveiling of the iMac.

title: The Man Who Invented Christmas
des: The journey that led to Charles Dickens' creation of "A Christmas Carol," a timeless tale that would redefine Christmas.

title: October Sky
des: The true story of Homer Hickam, a coal miner's son who was inspired by the first Sputnik launch to take up rocketry against his father's wishes.

title: All Eyez on Me
des: Tells the true and untold story of prolific rapper, actor, poet and activist Tupac Shakur.

title: Soul Surfer
des: Teenage surfer Bethany Hamilton overcomes the odds and her own fears of returning to the water after losing her left arm in a shark attack.

title: Charlie Wilson's War
des: A drama based on a Texas congressman Charlie Wilson's covert dealings in Afghanistan, where his efforts to assist rebels in their war with the Soviets have some unforeseen and long-reaching effects.

title: A Royal Affair
des: A young queen, who is married to an insane king, falls secretly in love with her physician - and together they start a revolution that changes a nation forever.

title: Testament of Youth
des: A British woman recalls coming of age during World War I - a story of young love, the futility of war, and how to make sense of the darkest times.

title: Spartacus: Gods of the Arena
des: In the time before the arrival of Spartacus, the House of Batiatus faces many challenges from competitors, and within its own household.

title: A Private War
des: One of the most celebrated war correspondents of our time, Marie Colvin is an utterly fearless and rebellious spirit, driven to the frontline of conflicts across the globe to give voice to the voiceless.

title: The Doors
des: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band The Doors and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison, from his days as a UCLA film student in Los Angeles, to his untimely death in Paris, France at age 27 in 1971.

title: Alive
des: A Uruguayan rugby team stranded in the snow swept Andes are forced to use desperate measures to survive after a plane crash.

title: Fruitvale Station
des: The story of Oscar Grant III, a 22-year-old Bay Area resident, who crosses paths with friends, enemies, family, and strangers on the last day of 2008.

title: Trumbo
des: In 1947, Dalton Trumbo was Hollywood's top screenwriter, until he and other artists were jailed and blacklisted for their political beliefs.

title: Billionaire Boys Club
des: A group of wealthy boys in Los Angeles during the early 1980s establish a 'get-rich-quick' scam that turns deadly.

title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
des: Wyoming, early 1900s. Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are the leaders of a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heels. Their solution - escape to Bolivia.

title: Professor Marston and the Wonder Women
des: The story of psychologist William Moulton Marston, and his polyamorous relationship with his wife and their mistress who would inspire his creation of the superheroine, Wonder Woman.

title: Bloodsport
des: Follows Frank Dux, an American martial artist serving in the military, who decides to leave the army to compete in a martial arts tournament in Hong Kong where fights to the death can occur.

title: Tucker: The Man and His Dream
des: The story of Preston Tucker, the maverick car designer and his ill-fated challenge to the auto industry with his revolutionary car concept.

title: Elizabeth
des: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

title: Hoffa
des: The story of the notorious American labor union figure Jimmy Hoffa, who organizes a bitter strike, makes deals with members of the organized crime syndicate and mysteriously disappears in 1975.

title: Red Joan
des: The story of Joan Stanley, who was exposed as the KGB's longest-serving British spy.

title: The Stanford Prison Experiment
des: In 1971, twenty-four male students are selected to take on randomly assigned roles of prisoners and guards in a mock prison situated in the basement of the Stanford psychology building.

title: Changeling
des: Grief-stricken mother Christine Collins (Angelina Jolie) takes on the L.A.P.D. to her own detriment when it tries to pass off an obvious impostor as her missing child.

title: The 33
des: Based on the real-life event, when a gold and copper mine collapses, it traps 33 miners underground for 69 days.

title: Lizzie
des: A psychological thriller based on the infamous 1892 murders of the Borden family.

title: Quills
des: In a Napoleonic era insane asylum, an inmate, the irrepressible Marquis De Sade, fights a battle of wills against a tyrannically prudish doctor.

title: The Runaways
des: A coming-of-age biographical film about the 1970s teenage all-girl rock band The Runaways. The relationship between band members Cherie Currie and Joan Jett is also explored.

title: Seven Years in Tibet
des: True story of Heinrich Harrer, an Austrian mountain climber who became friends with the Dalai Lama at the time of China's takeover of Tibet.

title: Papillon
des: A man befriends a fellow criminal as the two of them begin serving their sentence on a dreadful prison island, which inspires the man to plot his escape.

title: The Insider
des: A research chemist comes under personal and professional attack when he decides to appear in a 60 Minutes (1968) exposé on Big Tobacco.

title: My Friend Dahmer
des: A young Jeffrey Dahmer struggles to belong in high school.

title: The 15:17 to Paris
des: Americans discover a terrorist plot on a Paris-bound train.

title: City of Lies
des: Russell Poole and Jack Jackson investigate the murders of rappers Notorious B.I.G. and Tupac Shakur.

title: Stockholm
des: Based on the absurd but true 1973 bank heist and hostage crisis in Stockholm that was documented in the New Yorker as the origins of the 'Stockholm Syndrome'.

title: The Magical World of Disney
des: A Disney-produced anthology covering many different genres.

title: Glory
des: Robert Gould Shaw leads the U.S. Civil War's first all-black volunteer company, fighting prejudices from both his own Union Army, and the Confederates.

title: Unplanned
des: All Abby Johnson ever wanted to do was help women. As one of the youngest Planned Parenthood clinic directors in the nation, she believed in a woman's right to choose. Until the day she saw something that changed everything.

title: Lords of Chaos
des: A teenager's quest to launch Norwegian Black Metal in Oslo in the early 1990s results in a very violent outcome.

title: Lovelace
des: The story of Linda Lovelace, who is used and abused by the porn industry at the behest of her coercive husband before taking control of her life.

title: The Front Runner
des: In 1987, U.S. Senator Gary Hart's presidential campaign is derailed when he's caught in a scandalous love affair.

title: Hotel Rwanda
des: Paul Rusesabagina was a hotel manager who housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda.

title: The New World
des: The story of the English exploration of Virginia, and of the changing world and loves of Pocahontas.

title: The Other Boleyn Girl
des: Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII.

title: Ed Wood
des: Ambitious but troubled movie director Edward D. Wood Jr. tries his best to fulfill his dreams, despite his lack of talent.

title: McFarland, USA
des: Jim White moves his family after losing his last job as a football coach. He sees that some of the students are worth starting a cross-country team and turns seven students with no hope into one of the best cross-country teams.

title: The Iceman
des: The story of Richard Kuklinski, the notorious contract killer and family man. When finally arrested in 1986, neither his wife nor daughters had any clue about his real profession.

title: Secretariat
des: Penny Chenery Tweedy and colleagues guide her long-shot but precocious stallion to set, in 1973, the unbeaten record for winning the Triple Crown.

title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
des: A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works.

title: Charlie Says
des: The tragic tale of an all-American girl who was transformed into a cold-blooded killer in the summer of 1969.

title: Awakenings
des: The victims of an encephalitis epidemic many years ago have been catatonic ever since, but now a new drug offers the prospect of reviving them.

title: Gotti
des: The story of crime boss John Gotti and his son.

title: Alpha Dog
des: Johnny and a couple pals kidnap Jake's 15-year-old brother, Zach, then assigns his buddy Frankie to be Zach's minder. They develop a brotherly friendship. Zach parties with his captors as things begin to spin out of control.

title: Escape from Alcatraz
des: Alcatraz is the most secure prison of its time. It is believed that no one can ever escape from it, until three daring men make a possible successful attempt at escaping from one of the most infamous prisons in the world.

title: The Basketball Diaries
des: A teenager finds his dreams of becoming a basketball star threatened after he free falls into the harrowing world of drug addiction.

title: Yip Man ngoi zyun: Cheung Tin Chi
des: While keeping a low profile after his defeat by Ip Man, Cheung Tin Chi gets into trouble after getting in a fight with a powerful foreigner.
In 1947, Jackie Robinson becomes the first African-American to play in Major League Baseball in the modern era when he was signed by the Brooklyn Dodgers and faces considerable racism in the process.

title: Gia
des: The story of the life of Gia Carangi, a top fashion model from the late 1970s, from her meteoric rise to the forefront of the modeling industry, to her untimely death.

title: Free State of Jones
des: A disillusioned Confederate army deserter returns to Mississippi and leads a militia of fellow deserters and women in an uprising against the corrupt local Confederate government.

title: Selena
des: The true story of Selena Quintanilla-Perez, a Texas-born Tejano singer who rose from cult status to performing at the Astrodome, as well as having chart topping albums on the Latin music charts.

title: Jungle
des: A group of friends join a guide for a trek into the Bolivian jungle, searching for an Indian village. The men soon realize that the jungle is a difficult place to be.

title: All the President's Men
des: "The Washington Post" reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Richard Nixon's resignation.

title: Gandhi
des: Gandhi's character is fully explained as a man of nonviolence. Through his patience, he is able to drive the British out of the subcontinent. And the stubborn nature of Jinnah and his commitment towards Pakistan is portrayed.

title: Chaplin
des: A movie about the troubled and controversial life of the master comedy filmmaker Charlie Chaplin.

title: The Bling Ring
des: Inspired by actual events, a group of fame-obsessed teenagers use the internet to track celebrities' whereabouts in order to rob their homes.

title: Cleopatra
des: Queen Cleopatra VII of Egypt experiences both triumph and tragedy as she attempts to resist the imperial ambitions of Rome.

title: Roosevelt
des: A biographical drama about President Theodore Roosevelt.

title: Aguirre, the Wrath of God
des: In the 16th century, the ruthless and insane Don Lope de Aguirre leads a Spanish expedition in search of El Dorado.

title: Selma
des: A chronicle of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s campaign to secure equal voting rights via an epic march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, in 1965.

title: The White Crow
des: The story of Rudolf Nureyev's defection to the West.

title: Lords of Dogtown
des: The film follows the surf and skateboarding trends that originated in Venice, California during the 1970's.

title: The Best of Enemies
des: Civil rights activist Ann Atwater faces off against C.P. Ellis, Exalted Cyclops of the Ku Klux Klan, in 1971 Durham, North Carolina over the issue of school integration.

title: Patch Adams
des: The true story of a heroic man, Hunter "Patch" Adams, determined to become a medical doctor because he enjoys helping people. He ventured where no doctor had ventured before, using humour and pathos.

title: In the Name of the Father
des: A man's coerced confession to an IRA bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. An English lawyer fights to free them.

title: Frida
des: A biography of artist Frida Kahlo, who channeled the pain of a crippling injury and her tempestuous marriage into her work.

title: Suffragette
des: In 1912 London, a young working mother is galvanized into radical political activism supporting the right for women to vote, and is willing to meet violence with violence to achieve this end.

title: Vita & Virginia
des: It's the fascinating true story about the love affair between socialite and popular author Vita Sackville-West and literary icon Virginia Woolf.

title: A Prayer Before Dawn
des: The true story of an English boxer incarcerated in one of Thailand's most notorious prisons as he fights in Muay Thai tournaments to earn his freedom.

title: Jackie
des: Following the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy fights through grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define her husband's historic legacy.

title: Trial by Fire
des: The tragic and controversial story of Cameron Todd Willingham, who was executed in Texas for killing his three children after scientific evidence and expert testimony that bolstered his claims of innocence were suppressed.

title: Breathe
des: The inspiring true love story of Robin and Diana Cavendish, an adventurous couple who refuse to give up in the face of a devastating disease. Their heartwarming celebration of human possibility marks the directorial debut of Andy Serkis.

title: Mr. Jones
des: A Welsh journalist breaks the news in the western media of the famine in the Soviet Union in the early 1930s.

title: Borg vs. McEnroe
des: The story of the 1980 tennis rivalry between the placid Björn Borg and the volatile John McEnroe.

title: Concussion
des: In Pittsburgh, accomplished pathologist Dr. Bennet Omalu uncovers the truth about brain damage in football players who suffer repeated concussions in the course of normal play.

title: Heavenly Creatures
des: Two teenage girls share a unique bond; their parents, concerned that the friendship is too intense, separate them, and the girls take revenge.

title: Battle of the Sexes
des: The true story of the 1973 tennis match between World number one Billie Jean King and ex-champ and serial hustler Bobby Riggs.

title: Aquarius
des: A gritty 1960s cop drama about LAPD detective Sam Hodiak and his trainee, who must deal with gangs, brutal crimes, changing times, family crises and unhinged manipulative small-time crook Charles Manson, who's slowly building his cult.

title: Cinderella Man
des: The story of James Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer who came back to become a champion and an inspiration in the 1930s.

title: Malcolm X
des: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.

title: I'm Not There
des: Ruminations on the life of Bob Dylan, where six characters embody a different aspect of the musician's life and work.

title: The Duchess
des: A chronicle of the life of 18th-century aristocrat Georgiana, Duchess of Devonshire, who was reviled for her extravagant political and personal life.

title: The Color of Friendship
des: A white South African girl finds herself in a difficult situation when she is sent to spend a term with a black family in America.

title: The Walk
des: In 1974, high-wire artist Philippe Petit recruits a team of people to help him realize his dream: to walk the immense void between the World Trade Center towers.

title: Jeremiah Terminator LeRoy
des: A young woman named Savannah Knoop spends six years pretending to be the celebrated author JT LeRoy, the made-up literary persona of her sister-in-law.

title: Eddie the Eagle
des: The story of Eddie Edwards, the notoriously tenacious British underdog ski jumper who charmed the world at the 1988 Winter Olympics.

title: Finding Neverland
des: The story of Sir J.M. Barrie's friendship with a family who inspired him to create Peter Pan.

title: Stronger
des: Stronger is the inspiring real life story of Jeff Bauman, an ordinary man who captured the hearts of his city and the world to become a symbol of hope after surviving the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing.

title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
des: A mature Queen Elizabeth endures multiple crises late in her reign including court intrigues, an assassination plot, the Spanish Armada, and romantic disappointments.

title: Blonde
des: A fictionalized chronicle of the inner life of Marilyn Monroe.

title: Out of Africa
des: In 20th-century colonial Kenya, a Danish baroness/plantation owner has a passionate love affair with a free-spirited big-game hunter.

title: J. Edgar
des: J. Edgar Hoover, powerful head of the F.B.I. for nearly fifty years, looks back on his professional and personal life.

title: Jimi: All Is by My Side
des: A drama based on Jimi Hendrix's life as he left New York City for London, where his career took off.

title: Victoria & Abdul
des: Queen Victoria strikes up an unlikely friendship with a young Indian clerk named Abdul Karim.

title: Loving Vincent
des: In a story depicted in oil painted animation, a young man comes to the last hometown of painter Vincent van Gogh to deliver the troubled artist's final letter and ends up investigating his final days there.

title: American Animals
des: Four young men mistake their lives for a movie and attempt one of the most audacious heists in U.S. history.

title: The Last King of Scotland
des: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s.

title: Confessions of a Dangerous Mind
des: An adaptation of the cult memoir of game show impresario Chuck Barris, in which he purports to have been a CIA hitman.

title: The Last Emperor
des: The story of the final Emperor of China.

title: Loving Pablo
des: A journalist strikes up a romantic relationship with notorious drug lord Pablo Escobar.

title: The Infiltrator
des: A U.S. Customs official uncovers a money laundering scheme involving Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar.

title: The Iron Lady
des: An elderly Margaret Thatcher talks to the imagined presence of her recently deceased husband as she struggles to come to terms with his death while scenes from her past life, from girlhood to British prime minister, intervene.

title: Anthropoid
des: Based on the extraordinary true story of Operation Anthropoid, the WWII mission to assassinate SS General Reinhard Heydrich, the main architect behind the Final Solution and the Reich's third in command after Hitler and Himmler.

title: The Siege of Jadotville
des: Irish Commandant Pat Quinlan leads a stand off with troops against French and Belgian Mercenaries in the Congo during the early 1960s.

title: Freedom Writers
des: A young teacher inspires her class of at-risk students to learn tolerance, apply themselves and pursue education beyond high school.

title: The Informant!
des: The U.S. government decides to go after an agro-business giant with a price-fixing accusation, based on the evidence submitted by their star witness, vice president-turned-informant Mark Whitacre.

title: I Love You Phillip Morris
des: A cop turns con man once he comes out of the closet. Once imprisoned, he meets the second love of his life, whom he'll stop at nothing to be with.

title: Rescue Dawn
des: A U.S. fighter pilot's epic struggle of survival after being shot down on a mission over Laos during the Vietnam War.

title: The Right Stuff
des: The story of the original Mercury 7 astronauts and their macho, seat-of-the-pants approach to the space program.

title: Good Morning, Vietnam
des: In 1965, an unorthodox and irreverent DJ named Adrian Cronauer begins to shake up things when he is assigned to the U.S. Armed Services radio station in Vietnam.

title: A Dangerous Method
des: A look at how the intense relationship between Carl Jung and Sigmund Freud gives birth to psychoanalysis.

title: Julie & Julia
des: Julia Child's story of her start in the cooking profession is intertwined with blogger Julie Powell's 2002 challenge to cook all the recipes in Child's first book.

title: First They Killed My Father
des: Cambodian author and human rights activist Loung Ung recounts the horrors she suffered as a child under the rule of the deadly Khmer Rouge.

title: Yip Man 3
des: When a band of brutal gangsters led by a crooked property developer make a play to take over a local school, Master Ip is forced to take a stand.

title: The Catcher Was a Spy
des: A major league baseball player, Moe Berg, lives a double life working for the Office of Strategic Services.

title: The Man with the Iron Heart
des: As the German Fascists expand their borders, scorching Europe from end to end, two brave Czechs of the Resistance prepare for a suicide mission to assassinate Reinhard Heydrich, the hideous mastermind behind the "Final Solution".

title: Colonia
des: A young woman's desperate search for her abducted boyfriend draws her into the infamous Colonia Dignidad, a sect nobody has ever escaped from.

title: Man on the Moon
des: The life and career of legendary comedian Andy Kaufman.

title: Bully
des: A pack of naïve teenagers conspire to murder a mutual friend, whose aggressive demeanor has proved too much.

title: A Futile and Stupid Gesture
des: In the 1970s and '80s, National Lampoon's success and influence creates a new media empire overseen in part by the brilliant and troubled Douglas Kenney.

title: Mary Shelley
des: Life and facts of Mary Wollstonecraft Godwin, who at 16 met 21 year old poet Percy Shelley, resulting in the writing of Frankenstein.

title: Men of Honor
des: The story of Carl Brashear, the first African-American U.S. Navy Diver, and the man who trained him.

title: Henry V
des: In the midst of the Hundred Years War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.

title: Stand and Deliver
des: The story of Jaime Escalante, a high school teacher who successfully inspired his dropout prone students to learn calculus.

title: Imperium
des: A young FBI agent, eager to prove himself in the field, goes undercover as a white supremacist.

title: Grizzly Man
des: A devastating and heart-rending take on grizzly bear activists Timothy Treadwell and Amie Huguenard, who were killed in October of 2003 while living among grizzly bears in Alaska.

title: Born on the Fourth of July
des: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country he fought for.

title: Jersey Boys
des: The story of four young men from the wrong side of the tracks in New Jersey who came together to form the iconic 1960s rock group The Four Seasons.

title: Searching for Bobby Fischer
des: A prepubescent chess prodigy refuses to harden himself in order to become a champion like the famous but unlikable Bobby Fischer.

title: Trust
des: Rome, 1973. John Paul Getty III, the heir and younger member of an oil tycoons' saga, is kidnapped by the Italian mafia in order to get a ransom.

title: Louis Wain
des: Biopic of the prolific English artist who rose to prominence at the end of the 19th century.

title: Big Eyes
des: A drama about the awakening of painter Margaret Keane, her phenomenal success in the 1950s, and the subsequent legal difficulties she had with her husband, who claimed credit for her works in the 1960s.

title: I Can Only Imagine
des: The inspiring and unknown true story behind MercyMe's beloved, chart topping song that brings ultimate hope to so many is a gripping reminder of the power of true forgiveness.

title: Hands of Stone
des: The legendary Roberto Duran and his equally legendary trainer Ray Arcel change each other's lives.

title: Florence Foster Jenkins
des: The story of Florence Foster Jenkins, a New York heiress who dreamed of becoming an opera singer, despite having a terrible singing voice.

title: Mommie Dearest
des: The abusive and traumatic adoptive upbringing of Christina Crawford at the hands of her mother, screen queen Joan Crawford, is depicted.

title: My Week with Marilyn
des: Colin Clark, an employee of Sir Laurence Olivier, documents the tense interaction between Olivier and Marilyn Monroe during the production of The Prince and the Showgirl (1957).

title: Patton
des: The World War II phase of the career of the controversial American general, George S. Patton.

title: Good Night, and Good Luck.
des: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy.

title: Feud: Bette and Joan
des: Planned anthology series centering on famous feuds, including Bette Davis and Joan Crawford that is discontinued at the moment.

title: Three Identical Strangers
des: In 1980 New York, three young men who were all adopted meet each other and find out they're triplets who were separated at birth. But their quest to find out why turns into a bizarre and sinister mystery.

title: Bleed for This
des: The inspirational story of World Champion Boxer Vinny Pazienza who, after a near fatal car crash which left him not knowing if he'd ever walk again, made one of sport's most incredible comebacks.

title: The Sessions
des: A man in an iron lung who wishes to lose his virginity contacts a professional sex surrogate with the help of his therapist and priest.

title: All Is True
des: A look at the final days in the life of renowned playwright William Shakespeare.

title: The Butler
des: As Cecil Gaines serves eight presidents during his tenure as a butler at the White House, the civil rights movement, Vietnam, and other major events affect this man's life, family, and American society.

title: This Boy's Life
des: The story about the relationship between a rebellious 1950s teenager and his abusive stepfather, based on the memoirs of writer and literature Professor Tobias Wolff.

title: Notorious
des: The life and death story of Notorious B.I.G. (a.k.a. Christopher Wallace), who came straight out of Brooklyn to take the world of rap music by storm.

title: A Very English Scandal
des: British Liberal Party leader Jeremy Thorpe is accused of conspiracy to murder his gay ex-lover and forced to stand trial in 1979.

title: Milk
des: The story of Harvey Milk, and his struggles as an American gay activist who fought for gay rights and became California's first openly gay elected official.

title: My Left Foot
des: Christy Brown, born with cerebral palsy, learns to paint and write with his only controllable limb - his left foot.

title: Miracles from Heaven
des: Based on the incredible true story of the Beam family.

title: Mrs. Wilson
des: A grieving widow discovers that her seemingly ideal husband lived many secret lives.

title: John Adams
des: The life of one of the USA's Founding Fathers, its second President, and his role in the nation's first 50 years.

title: Kundun
des: From childhood to adulthood, Tibet's fourteenth Dalai Lama deals with Chinese oppression and other problems.

title: Winchester
des: Ensconced in her sprawling California mansion, eccentric firearm heiress Sarah Winchester believes she is haunted by the souls of people killed by the Winchester repeating rifle.

title: Gorillas in the Mist
des: The story of Dian Fossey, a scientist who came to Africa to study the vanishing mountain gorillas, and later fought to protect them.

title: Radioactive
des: A story of the scientific and romantic passions of Marie Sklodowska-Curie (Polish scientist) and Pierre Curie, and the reverberation of their discoveries throughout the 20th century.

title: Same Kind of Different as Me
des: International art dealer Ron Hall must befriend a dangerous homeless man in order to save his struggling marriage to his wife, a woman whose dreams will lead all three of them on the journey of their lives.

title: Churchill
des: 96 hours before the World War II invasion of Normandy, British Prime Minister Winston Churchill struggles with his severe reservations with Operation Overlord and his increasingly marginalized role in the war effort.

title: 24 Hour Party People
des: In 1976, Tony Wilson sets up Factory Records and brings Manchester's music to the world.

title: Kill the Messenger
des: Journalist Gary Webb, California 1996, started investigating CIA's role in the 1980s in getting crack cocaine to the black part of LA to get money and weapons to the Contras/freedom fighters in Nicaragua.

title: The Devils
des: In 17th-century France, Father Urbain Grandier seeks to protect the city of Loudun from the corrupt establishment of Cardinal Richelieu. Hysteria occurs within the city when he is accused of witchcraft by a sexually repressed nun.

title: Fire in the Sky
des: An Arizona logger mysteriously disappears for five days in an alleged encounter with a flying saucer in 1975.

title: Ali
des: A biography of sports legend Muhammad Ali, focusing on his triumphs and controversies between 1964 and 1974.

title: Capote
des: In 1959, Truman Capote learns of the murder of a Kansas family and decides to write a book about the case. While researching for his novel In Cold Blood, Capote forms a relationship with one of the killers, Perry Smith, who is on death row.

des: The death of King Henry VIII throws his kingdom into chaos because of succession disputes. His weak son King Edward VI is on his deathbed. Anxious to keep England true to the Reformation, a...                See full summary »

title: The Wizard of Lies
des: The fall of Bernie Madoff, whose Ponzi scheme robbed $65 billion from unsuspecting victims; the largest fraud in U.S. history.

title: Get Rich or Die Tryin'
des: A tale of an inner city drug dealer who turns away from crime to pursue his passion, rap music.

title: Chariots of Fire
des: Two British track athletes, one a determined Jew, and the other a devout Christian, compete in the 1924 Olympics.

title: Wolf Hall
des: After the downfall of Cardinal Wolsey, his secretary, Thomas Cromwell, finds himself amongst the treachery and intrigue of King Henry VIII's court and soon becomes a close advisor to the King, a role fraught with danger.

title: Ray
des: The story of the life and career of the legendary rhythm and blues musician Ray Charles, from his humble beginnings in the South, where he went blind at age seven, to his meteoric rise to stardom during the 1950s and 1960s.

title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
des: The story of a controversial pornography publisher and how he became a defender of free speech.

title: Mark Felt: The Man Who Brought Down the White House
des: The story of Mark Felt, who under the name "Deep Throat" helped journalists Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the Watergate scandal in 1972.

title: Santos Dumont
des: SANTOS DUMONT tells the story of the man who embodied the great transformations of the turn of the century, acclaimed almost worldwide as the first man to fly a plane - the 14 Bis. Set in ...                See full summary »

title: Unsolved: The Murders of Tupac and the Notorious B.I.G.
des: A scripted true crime series based on the murder investigations of Tupac Shakur and Biggie Smalls.

title: Goodbye Christopher Robin
des: The relationship between writer AA Milne and his son, Christopher Robin, and how this became the inspiration for Winnie the Pooh.

title: Blaze
des: A reimagining of the life and times of Blaze Foley, the unsung songwriting legend of the Texas Outlaw Music movement.

title: The Man Who Knew Infinity
des: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneer Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor, Professor G.H. Hardy.

title: Hitchcock
des: The relationship between Alfred Hitchcock and his wife Alma Reville during the filming of Psycho (1960) in 1959 is explored.

title: Radio
des: The story of a high school coach and the developmentally challenged man who he took under his wing.

title: Nowhere Boy
des: A chronicle of John Lennon's first years, focused mainly in his adolescence and his relationship with his stern aunt Mimi, who raised him, and his absentee mother Julia, who re-entered his life at a crucial moment in his young life.

title: Pride
des: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.

title: Untitled Elvis Presley Project
